CatDescriptText: Hazel Scott moved to the United States in 1924 from Trinidad.  By the 1940's she had a radio show and had performed on Broadway and in films.  In 1950 she was the first African American woman to have her own TV show, which was cancelled after she was accused of being a communist.  She died in 1981.
TitMainTitle: Reporter interviewing Hazel Scott seated with radio, in domestic interior with leaf patterned curtains
